articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: A very impressive win over Dundee was astonishing for both the variety of goals and also the similarity in their genesis.  Seven goals from seven different scorers is incredible, perhaps unmatched in our history.  By halftime, only four outfield players were not on the scoresheet.  You may conclude that this is a team that can [...]
articles.title: Incredible variety and also similarity from Celtic

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC were singing – and winning – in the rain at Parkhead last night as they powered their way to an emphatic 7-1 win over demoralised Dundee. The roof fell in on the visitors as the champions ran amok in a blistering opening period when Cameron Carter-Vickers, with his first goal of the campaign, got [...]
articles.title: 7 UP: WATCH AGAIN AS CELTIC RUN AMOK

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CALLUM McGREGOR struck a rare goal in Celtic’s 7-1 demolition of Dundee at Parkhead  last night. But the Hoops captain had to accept he had been upstaged by his interval replacement Daniel Kelly who claimed the strike of the night for his first counter for the champions. The 18-year-old midfielder brought the house down with [...]
articles.title: NO KIDDING: ‘WE NEED TO KEEP BACKING IT UP,’ INSISTS McGREGOR

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: TEENAGER Daniel Kelly was singing in the rain as he netted his first Celtic goal in the 7-1 hammering of Dundee last night. The gifted midfielder came on for captain Callum McGregor at the interval with the champions amazingly already six goals ahead. And the 18-year-old Youth Academy graduate added to the revelry in Paradise by [...]
articles.title: ‘BUZZING’ AND ‘BRILLIANT’: KELLY’S IN PARADISE

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS hailed his seven-goal wonders, but also spared a thought for devastated Dundee after an entertaining 7-1 romp in a downpour in Paradise last night. The champions were unstoppable as they raced to a 6-0 interval advantage as the goals stacked up with six different scorers putting the hapless visitors to the sword. Cameron Carter-Vickers, [...]
articles.title: ‘ABSOLUTELY OUTSTANDING,’ RODGERS HAILS PLAYERS AND FANS

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC 7 DUNDEE 1 UNSTOPPABLE Celtic stormed to a spectacular triumph in a lopsided confrontation at rain-lashed Parkhead this evening. The fans were singing in the rain as the champions blew Dundee away with a breathtaking display that saw them lead by six at the interval. The rollicking procession saw Cameron Carter-Vickers, Adam Idah, Matt [...]
articles.title: CELTIC 7 DUNDEE 1: SEVENTH HEAVEN AS HOOPS GO ON GOAL SPREE

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Live updates will appear below after 19.45.
articles.title: Celtic v Dundee, Live updates

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC welcome back Cameron Carter-Vickers for a first-team start against Dundee at Parkhead this evening. The influential centre-half made a second-half return from injury in the 3-1 win over Motherwell at Fir Park on Sunday and is for the kick-off against the Tayside club. It’s the USA World Cup defender’s first start since the 1-0 victory [...]
articles.title: CONFIRMED: CCV, YANG, IDAH GET THE NOD

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Dundee sit in sixth place, two points ahead of Hibs with seven games to play until the league splits between sixth and seventh.  Our incentives tonight will be absolute, but Dundee’s players will be hugely financially motivated to finish top six, an outcome that will have a material impact on their earnings. A late Mikey [...]
articles.title: Positive options available

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: IF BRENDAN RODGERS decides to replace Joe Hart with Luis Palma at some stage of this evening’s game against Dundee, the Celtic support would have every right to raise an eyebrow in surprise. It would be a fairly unusual substitution, no argument about that, but those same fans might just give the manager some time [...]
articles.title: ALEX’S ANGLE: NOTHING TO SHOUT ABOUT

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: LIEL ABADA may not kick another ball for Celtic this season – but Brendan Rodgers insists the club “will look after him well” in the midst of distressing off-the-field turmoil. The Israeli winger has failed to make the matchday squad for the past three games against St Mirren, Kilmarnock and Motherwell and there will be [...]

With the score deadlocked at 1-1 against a battling Motherwell, it made sense to remove a midfield anchorman and put on a playmaker. A section of [...]

articles.description: CELTIC are looking for a hat-trick of Premiership wins over Dundee at Parkhead this evening. The champions have beaten the Tayside outfit home and away – 3-0 on both occasions – and are determined not to slip in their quest for precious league points. In the previous encounter on Boxing Day at Dens Park, Paulo Bernardo [...]

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS has warned his Celtic players they will have to be firing on all cylinders when they face Dundee at Parkhead tomorrow night. The champions were alarmingly off the pace in the first 45 minutes as they trailed Motherwell 1-0 at Fir Park at the interval. A flying header from Adam Idah, who replaced Kyogo [...]

articles.description: We signed Hyeok-kyu Kwon (22) for €1m from K League 2 club Busan IPark.  He joined St Mirren on loan last month, where he has since made six appearances.  Watch this short video montage of him there. The Republic of Ireland international striker was a seemingly underwhelming loan signing from Championship outfit Norwich City late on deadline day. The strapping 6ft-plus attack leader made his debut as a second-half substitute against Aberdeen at Pittodrie [...]

articles.description: CELTIC’S frozen-out midfielder Kwon Hyeok-kyu is a loan Bhoy in demand. Kwon signed a temporary deal with Premiership rivals St Mirren last month and impressed [...]

articles.description: LIEL ABADA could be heading to the MLS to team up with former Celtic colleague Giorgos Giakoumakis. articles.description: FIVE years ago today, Neil Lennon returned to the Celtic dug-out in the wake of Brendan Rodgers’ hasty exit for Leicester City. articles.description: No one can convince you or I Celtic played well, against The ‘Well, yesterday.  Throughout the first half, the players looked like strangers.  At times, Motherwell ripped us open.  This was not league winning form.  None of that matters, though. When you are not playing well, all that matters is you pick up wins until [...]

At the interval, they were trailing by a Blair Spittal goal and looking miles off the pace with the [...]

articles.description: ON SATURDAY, May 26 2001, the sun beamed brightly on Hampden and Martin O’Neill as he brought down the curtain on his history-equalling first season as Celtic manager. Only the legendary Jock Stein had achieved the domestic clean sweep before in the Hoops’ history – and he did it twice, in seasons 1966/67 and 1968/69. [...]

articles.description:
More than 90 Minutes Annual Charity Dinner at the Number 10 Hotel, Glasgow after Celtic v St. Mirren Saturday 13 April. This year we are raising money for the 12th Lion Charity & we will also do our annual season ticket drive for the Kano Foundation on the night. Paul Sheridan from the The Wakes […]
